isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE / 9200 9300 9400 MODELS BUILT AFTER JANUARY 1, 1995 - ELECTRONIC ENGINE CONTROLS - CATERPILLAR 3406B -1991 - TROUBLESHOOTING

svcproc.title: TROUBLESHOOTING
svcproc.para: All PEEC equipped vehicles have a yellow "Engine Warning" lamp located in the cab. Every time the key is turned to the ignition position (engine must be started with Kysor Engine Shutdown), the warning lamp will come on for 10 seconds and turn off. If the light remains on, and flashes a code number, it is an indication that the PEEC system has detected a problem with the engine. Consult the Caterpillar PEEC manual furnished with the vehicle for further information.
To determine the fault codes, use the following procedure:

step1.para: Start and run engine at low idle for about 30 seconds.
Turn Key switch to Run position (not crank).
Turn Cruise ON/OFF switch to OFF position.
Hold Cruise SET/ACCEL RESUME/COAST switch in the RESUME position for 2 seconds and then release.

note.para: Caterpillar PEEC engine diagnostics must be performed with the engine running.

step1.para: Yellow Engine Warning light will flash first digit.
There will be a one to two second pause.
Yellow Engine Warning light will flash second digit.
There will be two to three seconds pause between fault codes.

note.para: All Caterpillar fault codes are two digits.

step1.para: The second and successive fault codes will flash until all codes have been shown.
To stop the diagnostics procedure, do nothing. To see the fault codes again, repeat steps 5 to 10.

svcproc.para: If a problem is detected by the ECM system, use the Electronic Control Analyzer Programmer (ECAP), the Digital Diagnostic Tool (DDT), and the Caterpillar Service Manual for further diagnostic procedures. The ECAP and DDT may be available at the nearest Caterpillar Service Center.

note.para: The ECAP service tool is sensitive to upper case and lower case letters. Use "CAP LOCKS" to switch back and forth. The DDT can only do numeric entries.
